Main.TextJPN: 情報屋ことサトさんは、私を自分の車に乗せて走り出した。
Main.TextENG: The informant, named Sato-san, had me get into his car before he set off.

Main.TextJPN: 狭い路地を好み、何度も小さく左折を繰り返す。
Main.TextENG: He favored narrow roads and made numerous short left turns.

Main.TextJPN: 「……左折法による尾行確認ですか？」
Main.TextENG: ``...Checking if we're being followed?``

Main.TextJPN: 「ん、…くわしいな」
Main.TextENG: ``Yeah... you know a lot about this.``

Main.TextJPN: 左折法は尾行を確認する技術の中でも古典的なものだ。@k一対一の尾行ならこれで確認できる。
Main.TextENG: Checking to see if you were being tailed by making left turns was a rather classic technique.@k If it was just a single pursuer, you could confirm it that way.

Main.TextJPN: …しかし、実際の尾行はチームで行なわれるので、こんな古典的な方法ではその場しのぎにしかならない。@k…無論、しないよりはした方がいいのだが。
Main.TextENG: ...But if you were being tailed as a team, this archaic method wouldn't let you shake them.@k ...Of course, doing it anyway was better than not.

Main.TextJPN: 「…赤坂くんが何者かは旦那から何も聞いてないんだが。@k@vS05/00/104400050.…やっぱり警察関係かい？@k@vS05/00/104400051.　尾行確認に詳しいなんて、あとは探偵社くらいしか思いつかねぇね」
Main.TextENG: ``...I didn't hear anything from the boss as to who you are, Akasaka-kun.@k@vS05/00/104400050. ...Related to the police?@k@vS05/00/104400051. If you're familiar with checking for being tailed, the only other possibility I can think of is something like a private detective.``

Main.TextJPN: 「言わなければならないものでないなら、拒否したい質問ですね」
Main.TextENG: ``If it's not something I have to say, I'd like to refuse to answer that question.``

Main.TextJPN: 「やれやれ…。@k@vS05/00/104400053.麻雀やってからすっかり雰囲気が大人びちまったな！@k@vS05/00/104400054.　会った時のあのオドオドしたあんたはどこ行っちゃったんだよ、はっはっはっは」
Main.TextENG: ``My my...@k@vS05/00/104400053. Ever since we played mahjong, you seem a lot more mature!@k@vS05/00/104400054. I wonder where that hesitant person went, from when we first met.``

Main.TextJPN: 苦笑する。
Main.TextENG: I smiled wryly.

Main.TextJPN: …今となっては、麻雀をやらせてもらったことに感謝してもいい。
Main.TextENG: ...Looking back now, I had to be a little grateful for being made to play mahjong.

Main.TextJPN: あれのお陰で自分のペースを取り戻せたのだから。
Main.TextENG: Thanks to that I was able to relieve some tension.

Main.TextJPN: やがてサトさんは、尾行してくる車両がないと判断すると、郊外へ向けて走り出した。
Main.TextENG: Eventually Sato-san, confirming that there were no cars following us, slipped outside the city.

Main.TextJPN: 外灯以外に何も見えない、真っ暗な田舎の道路。
Main.TextENG: We were on a pitch-black country road, unable to see anything besides the lights outside...

Main.TextJPN: …聞こえるのは、カーエアコンの唸る音と、カエルや虫の合唱だけだった。
Main.TextENG: ...The only things I was able to hear were the hum of the car's air-conditioning, and the chirping of insects and frogs.

Main.TextJPN: 「…旦那から、雛見沢村については多少のことは聞いてるんだろ？」
Main.TextENG: ``...I heard from the boss that you want to hear a bit about Hinamizawa Village, yeah?``

Main.TextJPN: 「御三家という旧家による支配や、現在は園崎家が一党独裁をしているとか、そういう話ですか？」
Main.TextENG: ``Like about the old houses known as the 'Three Families' who control the place, or that right now it's pretty much the Sonozaki family running things?``

Main.TextJPN: 「…そこまで知ってるなら、下らない前置きは省略していいな」
Main.TextENG: ``...If you know that much already, I'll cut out the introductions.``

Main.TextJPN: 「では、…お願いします。@k@vS05/13/101300383.……犬飼大臣の孫の誘拐に、鬼ヶ淵死守同盟が関与しているか、否かを」
Main.TextENG: ``Then, if you would.@k@vS05/13/101300383. ...Can you confirm or deny if the Onigafuchi Guardians is involved with the kidnapping of Minister Inukai's grandson?``

Main.TextJPN: サトさんは、もう一度バックミラーを見て、不審車が追って来ていないかを確認してから口を開いた。
Main.TextENG: Sato-san checked the rearview mirror one more time to confirm there wasn't anybody behind us before speaking.

Main.TextJPN: 「…昨夜、園崎本家で親族会議が開かれたそうだ。@k@vS05/00/104400058.親族会議ってのは…旦那から聞いてるか？」
Main.TextENG: ``...Last night, the Sonozaki main house held a family council.@k@vS05/00/104400058. Did you hear about it from the boss?``

Main.TextJPN: 「いえ」
「普通に親族会議って言ったら、まぁ親戚が集まってお茶でも飲むようなもんだよな。@k@vS05/00/104400060.だが、園崎本家の親族会議ってのは、そんなのんびりしたものたぁ訳が違う」
Main.TextENG: ``If it was a normal meeting, then it would just be all the relatives coming together over a nice cup of tea or something.@k@vS05/00/104400060. But, a family council held by the main house isn't quite so relaxed.``

Main.TextJPN: 園崎本家の親族会議。
Main.TextENG: A family council held by the Sonozaki main house.

Main.TextJPN: …それはまさに、雛見沢村を支配する支配者たちの会議。
Main.TextENG: ...That would be a meeting between those who truly controlled Hinamizawa Village.

Main.TextJPN: ただの親類の内輪話などなく、…村について。
Main.TextENG: They wouldn't be talking about private family matters... it would be about the village as a whole.

Main.TextJPN: 反ダムの抵抗運動について。@kその他もろもろの、…全てを決める、…事実上の村の運命を決めているのに他ならない。
Main.TextENG: About organizing activities against the dam project.@k Among other things... everything would be decided there. In reality, they were deciding the fate of the village.

Main.TextJPN: 会議の頂点は、園崎お魎。
Main.TextENG: At the head of the meeting was Oryou Sonozaki.

Main.TextJPN: …園崎明王とまで呼ばれ、恐れ敬われている最高の長。
Main.TextENG: ...More or less called 'Empress Sonozaki,' as the ultimate decision-maker of the clan she was to be feared and respected.

Main.TextJPN: ……老衰により、伏していることが多いというが、その一言には、村の命運を左右するほどの重みが今なお宿っている。
Main.TextENG: ...Infirm with old age, she was often unable to stand on her own, but her words carried enough weight to sway the fate of the village.

Main.TextJPN: 最近は少々体力が衰えたらしく、体調の悪い日には、床に伏していることもあるという。
Main.TextENG: It seemed that lately she had grown weak, and on days where she wasn't feeling well, remained bedridden.

Main.TextJPN: 体調の悪い時の親族会議では、お魎は床に入ったままで行われるらしい。
Main.TextENG: Family councils that occurred while she wasn't feeling well took place with her on the floor.

Main.TextJPN: …厳かな和室の真ん中に、布団に入ったまま、上半身だけを起こし、険しい顔をしている老女こそ、…園崎お魎、その人である…。
Main.TextENG: In the middle of a dignified Japanese-style room, still in a futon, only the upper half of her body sitting upright, a stern look on her face... that was Oryou Sonozaki...

Main.TextJPN: その脇に座するのが、…次期頭首の、園崎魅音。
Main.TextENG: Sitting next to her was her heir, Mion Sonozaki.

Main.TextJPN: まだ若く、いや…若いという言葉も相応しくない。@k幼さを残す少女。
Main.TextENG: She was still young... no, young wasn't quite the right word.@k She was a girl who remained childish.

Main.TextJPN: 園崎お魎の脇に座し、時折お魎の求めに応じて取り次ぎをする程度の役だが…。
Main.TextENG: Her role was to merely sit beside Oryou Sonozaki, sometimes responding to her requests... however...

Main.TextJPN: …お魎の跡を継ぐことを許された唯一の存在に他ならない。
Main.TextENG: She was the only one deemed worthy to succeed Oryou.

Main.TextJPN: お魎と同じ鷹の目を有し、…眼光だけで見るものの心臓を凍らせることができるという、…将来を期待された…頭首の孫娘。
Main.TextENG: She had the same hawkish eyes, enough to give pause to anybody who so much as looked at them... Much was expected of her in the future... this granddaughter of the Sonozaki's leader.

Main.TextJPN: そして、さらにその両脇には、他の御三家の公由家、古手家の重鎮たち数人が座する。
Main.TextENG: And, also on either side of her, sat several other important members of the remaining Three Families: the Kimiyoshi family, and the Furude family.

Main.TextJPN: 公由家の筆頭は、もちろん現雛見沢村の村長、公由喜一郎。
Main.TextENG: First on the list for the Kimiyoshi family was of course the mayor of Hinamizawa Village, Kiichiro Kimiyoshi.

Main.TextJPN: …そしてその脇に、直系の親族があと何人か並ぶ。
Main.TextENG: ...And lined up beside him were several more of his direct relatives.

Main.TextJPN: その反対側には、もう一つの御三家、古手家が座る。
Main.TextENG: Opposite to them sat the other of the Three Families, the Furude family.

Main.TextJPN: …古手家は、今では神主一家しかいないので、神主とその妻、そして娘の梨花が座るだけだ。
Main.TextENG: The Furude family was only comprised of the family of a Shinto priest, so the only ones sitting there were said priest, his wife, and their daughter Rika.

Main.TextJPN: 梨花は、村の年寄り連中にとても可愛がられているらしいが、それはこのお魎も例外ではないらしい。
Main.TextENG: Rika was doted on by many of the older folks in the village, and it seemed that Oryou was no exception.

Main.TextJPN: 親族会議に臨むだけで、寿命が三日縮む…とまで言われるほどの緊張感が漂うこの会議の毒気にも、梨花だけは例外のようだ。
Main.TextENG: While the stress from just attending a family council was said to be enough to shorten your lifespan by three days, it seemed like Rika was the only one exempt from that.

Main.TextJPN: 周りがどんなに張り詰めた雰囲気になろうとも、彼女だけはまったく気にせず、鼻歌混じりにお絵描き帳にラクガキをしているという。
Main.TextENG: No matter how charged the atmosphere was around her, she paid it no mind, instead humming along as she doodled in a sketchbook.

Main.TextJPN: 実際、昨夜の会議でも梨花は、うつ伏せになりながらお魎の布団に、まるでコタツのように足を突っ込み、鼻歌を歌いながらのんびりお絵描き帳にラクガキをしていたという。
Main.TextENG: In fact, the night before, lying on her stomach while humming and doodling, she nonchalantly tucked her legs into Oryou's futon like it was a kotatsu.

Main.TextJPN: ここまでが御三家。
Main.TextENG: All this was the Three Families.

Main.TextJPN: …そしてその周りを、園崎家の親類、縁者がぐるりと幾重にも取り囲むように並ぶ。
Main.TextENG: ...And all around the room, lined row-upon-row, were relatives of the Sonozaki family.

Main.TextJPN: 座布団が与えられるのは直系の親族だけだ。@kそれ以外は、ただ畳の上に正座するだけ。
Main.TextENG: The only ones who were afforded cushions to sit on were direct relatives.@k The others were left to sit in the seiza position directly on the tatami mats.

Main.TextJPN: ……園崎明王を中心に、…まるで巨大で長い蛇がとぐろを巻くように…ぐるりと鎮座しているのだ。@kそして、…その座る順序、場所には徹底した序列が決められている…。
Main.TextENG: With Empress Sonozaki enshrined at their center, they were almost like a giant snake coiled around the room.@k It was decided that everybody would sit in order of their rank...

Main.TextJPN: 圧倒的人数は結局、園崎家だ。
Main.TextENG: The number of people from the Sonozaki family was overwhelming.

Main.TextJPN: …村の全てを決める会議の席が、園崎家にこれだけ許されていることを見れば、…御三家の力関係は火を見るより明らかにわかる…。
Main.TextENG: The fact that the Sonozaki family held so many seats at a meeting where everything pertaining to the village was decided made determining where the balance of power was held in the Three Families as clear as day.

Main.TextJPN: 出席している御三家の人数がそのまま、今の雛見沢村支配への影響力と見て取れた。
Main.TextENG: The number of members in attendance from each of the families directly reflected how much influence they had in ruling Hinamizawa.

Main.TextJPN: 「……その会議で、…何が話されたんですか？」
Main.TextENG: ``...What was talked about... at that meeting?``

Main.TextJPN: サトさんは、しばらくの間、沈黙を守った後、静かに語り始めた…。
Main.TextENG: Sato-san, after remaining silent for a while, quietly began to speak...

Main.TextJPN: 「…マスコミ関係に支払ってる謝礼金の額が、大きいんじゃあないかい」
Main.TextENG: ``...Wasn't our monetary gift of appreciation to the media a little large?``

Main.TextJPN: 長い沈黙を破り、切り出したのは公由家頭首の公由喜一郎だった…。
Main.TextENG: Breaking the long moment of silence was the head of the Kimiyoshi family, Kiichirou Kimiyoshi...

Main.TextJPN: 鬼ヶ淵死守同盟は会社ではない。
Main.TextENG: The Onigafuchi Guardians wasn't a business.

Main.TextJPN: …雛見沢ダム計画撤回を目指す任意団体に過ぎず、決まった収入源はない。
Main.TextENG: ...They were nothing more than a private organization pushing for the cancellation of the Hinamizawa Dam Project, with no reliable source of income.

Main.TextJPN: 活動当初こそ、多額の寄付金が集まったが、闘争の長期化に伴い、その額は年々減少する傾向にあった…。
Main.TextENG: When they first started operating, they had managed to collect a sizable amount of funds through donations, but as the conflict dragged on, that amount was steadily declining.

Main.TextJPN: 「…石を投げるだけが全ての時代じゃないさ。@k@vS05/00/104600010.マスコミの力も侮れないのは重々承知しているし、今後もその力を借りたいのは同じさ」
Main.TextENG: ``...This isn't an era where you can get what you want just by throwing rocks.@k@vS05/00/104600010. It's very important you don't underestimate the power of the media, and we want to borrow some of that down the road.``

Main.TextJPN: 園崎家に縁のある人間たちの表情は重い。
Main.TextENG: The expressions of the people related to the Sonozaki family were sullen.

Main.TextJPN: …マスコミの力を取り入れるべきだと発案したのは、彼らの長、園崎お魎だからだ。
Main.TextENG: ...As the one who suggested that they should borrow that power was the family head, Oryou Sonozaki.

Main.TextJPN: 戦いは武力によるものだけではない。
Main.TextENG: The battle wasn't just about force of arms.

Main.TextJPN: 文明の時代には、文明の時代の戦い方がある。
Main.TextENG: In this civilized age, there were civilized methods of fighting.

Main.TextJPN: …お魎はそう提案し、マスコミを取り入れた戦略方針を打ち出したのだ。
Main.TextENG: ...Oryou suggested that, creating a strategy incorporating the mass media.

Main.TextJPN: お魎の先見性は的中し、…当初は不透明だったその効果も、じわりじわりと現れ始めていた。
Main.TextENG: Oryou's foresight was spot on... and the effects of that plan, while at first unclear, slowly began to manifest.

Main.TextJPN: 建設現場への武力闘争が、工事を一日でも遅らせる守りの戦術なら、@k…マスコミを使った情報戦略は、工事計画そのものを追い込む攻めの戦術。
Main.TextENG: If the physical confrontation at the construction site was meant to delay progress on the dam by even one day,@k ...then the propaganda war using the media was aimed at attacking the dam project itself.

Main.TextJPN: 当初、その戦略に疑問を持っていた者たちも、今では誰もその成果を疑ってはいなかった…。
Main.TextENG: At first, there were those who had doubts about that strategy, but there was nobody now who called those results into question...

Main.TextJPN: だが、マスコミを繋ぎとめるには、常に膨大な資金を必要とされた。
Main.TextENG: But in order to maintain those media ties, a colossal amount of money was required.

Main.TextJPN: 活動資金が潤沢なうちはよかった。
Main.TextENG: As long as the amount of funds they had was abundant, things would turn out fine.

Main.TextJPN: 膨大な支出を認めながらも、その成果に手応えを感じられたからだ。
Main.TextENG: It couldn't be argued that it was a massive expense, but the results spoke for themselves.

Main.TextJPN: …だが、闘争の長期化に伴い、当時と今ではまったく事情が異なる。
Main.TextENG: ...But, with the conflict continuing to drag on, the circumstances had changed.

Main.TextJPN: 園崎家頭首…いや、雛見沢御三家の頂点に座すお魎が、自ら発案したものだからと、常に聖域的に、予算の削減を免れてきたのだ。
Main.TextENG: The head of the Sonozaki family-- no, the one who sat at the pinnacle of the Hinamizawa's Three Families, Oryou, had suggested the idea herself, so it was already untouchable, and continued to be allowed to drain from the budget.

Main.TextJPN: …誰もが、削るべきであると認識しながら、言い出せない。@k…それがマスコミへの支出だった。
Main.TextENG: ...Nobody acknowledged that it should be so allowed, but nobody could say anything.@k ...That was the price of dealing with the mass media.

Main.TextJPN: 「…どう思う、お魎さん」
Main.TextENG: ``...What do you think, Oryou-san?``

Main.TextJPN: 園崎家頭首自らの提案に、異論を挟める人間は、…恐らく村長の公由だけだった。
Main.TextENG: The only person who could object to a plan proposed by the head of the Sonozaki household herself was probably Mayor Kimiyoshi.

Main.TextJPN: お魎は、…俗世のあらゆる感情の束縛から解放されたような、…形容しがたい表情で、ただ静かに公由の言葉に耳を傾けていた。
Main.TextENG: Oryou... with a hard-to-define expression on her face, as if she had severed herself from the fetters of mortal emotion, simply listened quietly to Kimiyoshi's words.

Main.TextJPN: ……もっとも、それが静かに聞いているのか、聞く気すらないのかはわからないが。
Main.TextENG: ...But really, it was hard to tell if she was quietly listening or didn't even have the intention of listening at all.

Main.TextJPN: 「去年、機関紙の値上げの理解を得るのにもずいぶん苦労したじゃない。@k@vS05/18/103300012.…一度だけってことで理解を得て、…また今年もって訳には行かないよ…。@k@vS05/18/103300013.…ねぇ、古手さん」
Main.TextENG: ``Last year, we went through a lot of trouble getting people to wrap their heads around the price hike on the bulletins we were putting out.@k@vS05/18/103300012. ...We convinced them it was just the one time... it just wouldn't do if we had another one this year...@k@vS05/18/103300013. ...Right, Furude-san?``

Main.TextJPN: 古手家の神主とその妻に村長が、同意を求める。
Main.TextENG: The mayor looked to the priest and his wife from the Furude family for affirmation.

Main.TextJPN: …神主は曖昧な顔をして、即答を避けていた。
Main.TextENG: ...The priest gave a vague expression, avoiding a prompt response.

Main.TextJPN: だが妻は躊躇せず答える。
Main.TextENG: But his wife gave her answer without a second thought.

Main.TextJPN: 「そうですね…。@k@vS05/00/VT2_rikaM1002.機関紙代は、特に貧しい家には大きな負担になってます。@k@vS05/00/VT2_rikaM1003.みんな自分たちの村のためだからと堪えてますが、これ以上の値上げはやめた方がいいでしょうね」
Main.TextENG: ``That's right...@k@vS05/00/VT2_rikaM1002. The cost of the bulletins are a particularly harsh burden for the poorer families.@k@vS05/00/VT2_rikaM1003. Everybody is dealing with it for the sake of the village, but it's best we don't increase the prices any more.``

Main.TextJPN: 機関紙とは、その名が示すとおり、鬼ヶ淵死守同盟が発行する機関紙である。
Main.TextENG: The bulletin was, as its name implied, a bulletin published by the Onigafuchi Guardians.

Main.TextJPN: 同盟の活動の紹介や、理念、決意などが記されたものだが、非常に粗末な内容であることは否めない。
Main.TextENG: It outlined the Alliance's activities, ideals, and resolve, but you couldn't deny the contents were rather piecemeal.

Main.TextJPN: この機関紙は、その内容による周知が目的でなく、村人や関係者、協力企業に購読させて、その代金を吸い上げることを主な目的としている。@k…言わば、税金のようなものになっているのである。
Main.TextENG: That bulletin's main goal wasn't to inform people, but rather was something to sell to businesses and people living in the village or connected to it, and using those sales to collect funds.@k ...In other words, it had become something of a tax.

Main.TextJPN: もちろん、これが鬼ヶ淵死守同盟の大きな資金源となっているのは言うまでもない。
Main.TextENG: Of course, it didn't have to be said that this was one of the main sources of income for the Onigafuchi Guardians.

Main.TextJPN: 本来、購読は自由意志によるものだが、雛見沢においては暗黙の内に購読は義務化している。
Main.TextENG: Originally, purchase was supposed to be voluntary, but in Hinamizawa it had silently become the opposite.

Main.TextJPN: 周辺の町でも、同盟と事を荒立てない為、泣く泣く購読している会社も多いらしい。
Main.TextENG: In the neighboring towns as well, it seemed that many businesses were buying copies just to avoid butting heads with the Alliance.

Main.TextJPN: …神主が小声で妻に、余計なことは言わない方がいい…と囁くが、妻は冷たい目線でぴしゃりとそれを跳ね除けた。
Main.TextENG: ...The priest whispered to his wife to not say anything unnecessary, but was struck down decidedly with a cold glare.

Main.TextJPN: その冷たい目線に畏縮し、神主は口を閉ざしてしまう。
Main.TextENG: Cowering from that glare, the priest shut his mouth.

Main.TextJPN: 二人の立場は常に妻の方が強かった。@k…それは、古手の血筋を引くのが妻の方だからだ。
Main.TextENG: The priest's wife always held the power in their relationship.@k ...That was because she was the one who carried the Furude bloodline.

Main.TextJPN: 神主は婿養子に過ぎない。@k古手に嫁ぐことによって御三家に列することとなった外様に過ぎない。
Main.TextENG: The priest merely married into the family.@k He was nothing more than somebody who adopted the name just to join the Three Families.

Main.TextJPN: 序列上、かなりの高位な位置に座することを許されているが、…その発言力の弱さは、依然、外様扱いを受けていることをまざまざと感じさせた。
Main.TextENG: He should have been able to find a spot fairly high up in the hierarchy of things, ...but the lack of authority in his voice meant that he had still not gained any favor.

Main.TextJPN: そんな、温度差のある両親を尻目に、娘の梨花は、まったく気にせず、お絵描き帳に気ままにラクガキを続けているのだった。
Main.TextENG: Casting a backwards glance at her rather disparate parents, Rika continued to doodle whimsically without paying them any mind.

Main.TextJPN: お魎が魅音に目で合図をすると、魅音が耳をお魎に近付ける。
Main.TextENG: Signaled by a look from Oryou, Mion brought her ear closer to her grandmother.

Main.TextJPN: そして、何かをごしょごしょと小声で伝えていた。
Main.TextENG: There, something was said to her in a quiet voice.

Main.TextJPN: 二言三言、魅音が尋ね返し、それにお魎が頷くと、魅音は周りを見渡してからお魎の言葉を代弁した…。
Main.TextENG: After responding with a couple questions, with a nod from Oryou, Mion looked around the room and conveyed her grandmother's words...

Main.TextJPN: 「…機関紙の値上げも止むを得ません」
Main.TextENG: ``...There will be no freeze on the price increase for the bulletin.``

Main.TextJPN: 公由たちは一瞬、苦虫を潰したような顔をしたが、その表情は、まるで始めからなかったかのように掻き消える…。
Main.TextENG: Kimiyoshi made a face like he had just bit into something unpleasant, but that expression quickly disappeared like it had never happened at all...

Main.TextJPN: 「だ、…だけど魅音ちゃん。@k@vS05/18/103300015.…君だってわかってると思うけど、機関紙の負担は決して軽いものじゃない。@k@vS05/18/103300016.雛見沢の全ての人間にかかる重みなんだ。@k@vS05/18/103300017.あまり負担をかけ過ぎれば、内部から崩れることだって…、」
Main.TextENG: ``B-But, Mion-chan.@k@vS05/18/103300015. ...I think you already know this, but the cost of the bulletin is by no means easily affordable.@k@vS05/18/103300016. It's a burden carried by everybody in Hinamizawa.@k@vS05/18/103300017. If we make people carry too much of that burden, it's possible we'll collapse from the inside...``

Main.TextJPN: 「…内部から崩れるのは誰ですか？」
Main.TextENG: ``...And who on the inside would start that collapse?``

Main.TextJPN: 「誰って、…別にそういう意味じゃ、」
Main.TextENG: ``Who? ...I didn't mean it like that--``

Main.TextJPN: 「…最初に崩れるのは誰かと聞いています」
Main.TextENG: ``...I'm asking who would be the first to buckle.``

Main.TextJPN: まだ幼さの欠片を残す少女に詰問され、公由は言葉を喉の奥に詰め込まれ、黙り込まされてしまう。
Main.TextENG: Being cross-examined by a girl who still had fragments of childishness remaining within her, the words stuck in Kimiyoshi's throat as he sunk into silence.

Main.TextJPN: 魅音は、同じ言葉をもう一度口にし、満座の人間たちを…ぐるりと見渡した。
Main.TextENG: Mion repeated her question once more, looking around the crowded room.

Main.TextJPN: その眼光に瞳を射抜かれまいと、…皆、落ち着きなく目線を逸らす…。
Main.TextENG: Everybody refrained making eye contact to avoid being pierced by her gaze...

Main.TextJPN: 彼女が口にした言葉は無論、お魎のそれを代弁したものだ。
Main.TextENG: The words she had spoken were unarguably said in proxy for Oryou.

Main.TextJPN: だから、魅音の口から出ようと、その重みはお魎のそれと何も変わらない。@k…だが、眼光だけは違った。
Main.TextENG: That's why when Mion spoke them, they carried the same weight.@k ...But, the look in her eyes was different.

Main.TextJPN: お魎と同じ、見るものの心を心底凍えさせ、屈服を強いるような鷹の眼差しに違いはない。
Main.TextENG: Like Oryou's, they had a hawkish gaze, strong enough that anybody looking upon them would freeze in their tracks and yield.

Main.TextJPN: …だが、その眼差しは紛れもなく、魅音自身のものなのだ。
Main.TextENG: ...But, that gaze was without question, one that belonged to Mion herself.

Main.TextJPN: 魅音はやがて、お魎の全てを受け継ぎ、若く有能な頭首として独立する日が来るだろう。
Main.TextENG: As Mion would eventually inherit everything from Oryou, the day when she would stand up as a young and capable leader in her own right would come.

Main.TextJPN: …その時の心証を少しでも損ねたくない。
Main.TextENG: ...Nobody wanted to believe otherwise for even a minute.

Main.TextJPN: …そう思えばこそ、誰も魅音のことを小娘だなどとは思わなかった。
Main.TextENG: ...That's why, nobody even thought of Mion as just some sort of little kid.

Main.TextJPN: 「…公由さん。@k@vS05/26/100300005.機関紙の値上げ如きでは、誰の決意も崩れませんよ」
Main.TextENG: ``...Kimiyoshi-san.@k@vS05/26/100300005. Nobody will lose their resolve over something like a price hike on the bulletin.``

Main.TextJPN: 公由は小さく唸りながら、反論はないというようなジェスチャーをして見せた。
Main.TextENG: Kimiyoshi, while grumbling a little bit, made a gesture as if to say he had no objection.

Main.TextJPN: 「…マスコミ関係への出費は継続とします。@k@vS05/26/100300007.その出費がさらに圧迫となるようなら、機関紙の値上げも止むを得ない」
Main.TextENG: ``...The expenses related to the mass media will continue.@k@vS05/26/100300007. If those expenses become too much, we'll have no choice but to continue the price hikes.``

Main.TextJPN: 魅音によって裁断が下される。
Main.TextENG: Mion had rendered her judgement.

Main.TextJPN: …一同は深く頭を垂れ、黙ってその言葉に耳を傾けていた。
Main.TextENG: Everybody bowed their heads, silently listening to her words.

Main.TextJPN: 「園崎家頭首代行、園崎魅音です。@k@vS05/26/100300009.我が名において以上を決定し、決定の効力は即日発効されるものとします。@k@vS05/26/100300010.…異議はこれを認めず、抵抗ある場合は実力を以て排除します」
Main.TextENG: ``In the name of Mion Sonozaki, as acting head of the Sonozaki family.@k@vS05/26/100300009. I hereby declare that all this shall be effective immediately.@k@vS05/26/100300010. ...There shall be no objections, and any opposition shall be removed by force.``

Main.TextJPN: 判決を意味する定型文が読み上げられる。
Main.TextENG: The formal decree was read aloud, indicating her judgement.

Main.TextJPN: …再審がないという意味においては、裁判所のそれとは比べ物にならない重みがあった…。
Main.TextENG: ....There would be no retrial. But there was a certain authority behind those words that even a courthouse couldn't compare to.

Main.TextJPN: 裁判官なら槌を叩き、決着の印とするように。
Main.TextENG: If she was a judge, she would have banged her gavel, signaling that the matter was settled.

Main.TextJPN: …魅音が懐から大き目の鈴を取り出すと、それを揺すり鳴らした。
Main.TextENG: ...Mion pulled out a large bell from inside her clothes and rang it.

Main.TextJPN: …厳かな鈴の音に、一堂は平伏するほかなかった…。
Main.TextENG: Everybody present could only prostrate themselves before the harsh sound of the bell.

Main.TextJPN: 「………何とも、…大時代的な親族会議ですね」
Main.TextENG: ``...Well. ...That's a rather old-fashioned family council, isn't it.``

Main.TextJPN: 「あんたみたいな若い者にゃ、ちょっと信じられないだろうけどね。@k@vS05/00/104400062.…こういう古い土地には、こんなのが未だ根強く残ってるもんさ」
Main.TextENG: ``A young guy like you would probably find it hard to believe.@k@vS05/00/104400062. ...In an antiquated place like this, these types of things have firm roots.``

Main.TextJPN: 大石氏の話の通りだった。
Main.TextENG: It was exactly as Ooishi had said.

Main.TextJPN: …御三家という古い習慣はすでに失われており、今は園崎家が単独で支配している。
Main.TextENG: ...The old system of the Three Families had vanished, and now the Sonozaki family was running things by themselves.

Main.TextJPN: それも、独裁と呼べるような水準で。
Main.TextENG: On top of that, their rule was borderline despotic.

Main.TextJPN: 「…会議はそれで終わりですか？」
Main.TextENG: ``...Was that the end of the meeting?``
``No, there's more.@k@vS05/00/104400064. I'll continue.``

Main.TextJPN: やがて、…鈴の音が止むと、耳が痛くなるような沈黙が訪れた。
Main.TextENG: Eventually, after the ringing of the bell ceased, there was a deafening silence.

Main.TextJPN: その中を、ひとりの男がすり足で、スススっと魅音に近付き、何かを小さく耳打ちした。
Main.TextENG: Within all of that, a lone man shuffled closer to Mion and whispered something in her ear.

Main.TextJPN: 魅音はそれに対し、小声でいくつか尋ねなおす。
Main.TextENG: Mion asked several questions quietly in response.

Main.TextJPN: そして納得が行くと、もう下がっていいという風な仕草をして、男を下がらせた。
Main.TextENG: When she was satisfied, she motioned for the man to leave.

Main.TextJPN: …魅音に何かを伝えた男は、魅音の実父が幹部を務める暴力団組織の構成員だった。
Main.TextENG: ...The man who talked to Mion was a member of a gang that her father was the leader of.

Main.TextJPN: 組織は鹿骨市全域を翼下とする広域なもので、この地域ではかなり知られたものだ。
Main.TextENG: That organization had the entire area of Shishibone City under its control, so it was quite well known even here.

Main.TextJPN: …もちろん、日の当たる世界の話ではないので、誰もが知っているわけではないが…、@kその代紋のバッヂを見せるだけで、この界隈では揉め事に決着がついてしまうことすらある…。
Main.TextENG: ...Of course, this was talking about the criminal underworld, so it's not like just anybody would know...@k But just showing a patch with the gang symbol on it was enough to resolve any disputes in the neighborhood...

Main.TextJPN: 魅音の実父、お魎にとっての娘の夫。
Main.TextENG: Mion's biological father, to Oryou, was her daughter's husband.

Main.TextJPN: …この男が持つ暴力団の力は、鬼ヶ淵死守同盟の暗部を司る力に他ならない。
Main.TextENG: The power of that man's gang was the driving force that controlled the dark underbelly of the Onigafuchi Guardians.

Main.TextJPN: …そしてその男は、御三家に次ぐ最も高位な席で、一種異様な気配を滲ませて、周囲を威圧し続けていた…。
Main.TextENG: ...And so that man, from his position as the next-in-line to control the Three Families, continued to coerce everybody around him with his unconventional presence...

Main.TextJPN: 魅音は父に目配せをする。
Main.TextENG: Mion exchanged a look with her father.

Main.TextJPN: …今、伝えられた情報を、そのままお魎に伝えても良いか。
Main.TextENG: ...Was it okay for her to tell what she just heard directly to Oryou?

Main.TextJPN: …そう尋ねているように見えた。
Main.TextENG: ...It looked like she was asking him that question.

Main.TextJPN: 父は軟らかく、だけれども力強く頷き返事とした。
Main.TextENG: Her father gently, but firmly, nodded his response.

Main.TextJPN: 魅音も頷き返し、そしてお魎の耳元に身を寄せ、何かを伝えていた…。
Main.TextENG: Mion also nodded, then sidled up to Oryou and informed her of something...

Main.TextJPN: やがて魅音は伝え終わり、お魎の耳元から離れると姿勢を正し、…お魎が反応を示すのを待った。
Main.TextENG: Eventually, Mion finished conveying her message, separated herself from Oryou, and fixed her posture, waiting for Oryou to signal her response.

Main.TextJPN: お魎が表情を浮かべることは、そう多くない。
Main.TextENG: It wasn't often that Oryou showed any emotion.

Main.TextJPN: …だから、お魎が声を殺しながら笑い始めた時、一同はその反応の意味するところに漠然とした不安を抱くことしかできなかった。
Main.TextENG: ...That's why, when she started to laugh quietly, a vague sense of uneasiness crept over everybody in the room.

Main.TextJPN: 「…そら、…難儀なこともあったものよのぉ。@k@vS05/17/102300002.…くっくっくっく…！」
Main.TextENG: ``...That's... quite the conundrum isn't it.@k@vS05/17/102300002. ...Keh keh keh keh...!``

Main.TextJPN: お魎がさも愉快そうに笑い出したので、…公由は恐る恐る尋ねる。
Main.TextENG: Oryou was laughing so happily that Kimiyoshi had to hesitantly ask.

Main.TextJPN: 「…どうしたんだいお魎さん」
Main.TextENG: ``...What is it, Oryou-san?``

Main.TextJPN: 「…我等にとって土地が母なら、…此度のダムの騒ぎは、母の命を脅かされる騒ぎちゅうこったろなぁ」
Main.TextENG: ``...If this land is like a mother to us... then this business with the dam is like somebody threatening our mother's life, isn't it?``

Main.TextJPN: 公由は何の話かわからず、一瞬、面食らう。
Main.TextENG: Kimiyoshi, unable to comprehend the meaning of her words, looked confused.

Main.TextJPN: お魎はにやぁ…と笑ってから、全員に向かって、一際大きな声で言った。
Main.TextENG: Oryou, with a wide grin on her face, turned towards everybody and addressed them in a clarion voice.

Main.TextJPN: 「…ダムの親玉の大臣がの、…孫、さらわれちまって、右往左往しとるっちゅう話だ。@k@vS05/17/102300005.こんれでお相子だの。@k@vS05/17/102300006.…くっくっくっく！」
Main.TextENG: ``...The Minister behind the Dam Project, is apparently rattled over the kidnapping of his grandson.@k@vS05/17/102300005. That makes us even.@k@vS05/17/102300006. ...keh keh keh keh!``

Main.TextJPN: 「…バカなッ！！！」
Main.TextENG: ``...That's absurd!!!``

Main.TextJPN: 犬飼大臣の孫が誘拐された話は、…どこにも漏れていないはずだ。@k…それをどうして知っている？！
Main.TextENG: Information on the kidnapping of Minister Inukai's grandson... shouldn't have leaked from anywhere.@k ...How did they know!?

Main.TextJPN: …大臣の孫の誘拐は、我々ですらその詳細を知りかねている事件だ。
Main.TextENG: Even we didn't know much about the kidnapping incident.

Main.TextJPN: それを…どうして、こんな東京から遥か離れた田舎の旧家が知るに至れるんだ？
Main.TextENG: Exactly how did an antiquated household so far away from Tokyo come to know of it?

Main.TextJPN: …………のどかなのに、どこか薄気味悪さを感じずにはいられない、雛見沢村。
Main.TextENG: ...It was a tranquil place, but I couldn't help but have an uneasy feeling about Hinamizawa Village.

Main.TextJPN: …でも、今回の事件とだけは無関係だと、心のどこかで勝手に決め付けてきた。
Main.TextENG: ...At some point, I had mentally filed this place away as unrelated to the incident at hand.

Main.TextJPN: …その決め付けが、…薄っぺらく吹き飛ばされる。
Main.TextENG: ...That mental paperwork had just blown away in the wind.

Main.TextJPN: 「……どうして、…鬼ヶ淵死守同盟が知っているんだ…」
Main.TextENG: ``...How... did the Onigafuchi Guardians know about that...``

Main.TextJPN: サトさんは答える言葉を見つけられず、しばらくの間、黙り込んでいた…。
Main.TextENG: Sato-san, unable to come up with an answer, fell into silence...

Main.TextJPN: 「…すみません。@k@vS05/13/101300391.続きをお願いします」
Main.TextENG: ``...I'm sorry.@k@vS05/13/101300391. Please continue.``

Main.TextJPN: 「…あぁ」
「犬飼建設大臣のお孫さんが、…さらわれた？@k@vS05/18/103300022.　…お魎さん、そりゃ本当かい？」
Main.TextENG: ``The Minister of Construction's grandson... was kidnapped?@k@vS05/18/103300022. ...Oryou-san, is that true?``

Main.TextJPN: そんな大事件、新聞でもニュースでも言っていない。
Main.TextENG: That major of an incident was nowhere to be seen in the newspapers or on TV.

Main.TextJPN: …でも、この雛見沢では、世間が知りえないことをお魎だけが知っていても、何の不思議にも思わなかった。
Main.TextENG: ...But, in Hinamizawa, there was nothing strange about Oryou knowing something that the rest of the world didn't.

Main.TextJPN: 「我らの痛みは母を失う痛みじゃの。@k@vS05/17/102300008.…それに値するとは思わんが、孫を失う痛み。@k@vS05/17/102300009.…くっくっくっく！@k@vS05/17/102300010.　少しは堪えるといいんじゃがのぉ。@k@vS05/17/102300011.……なぁ？」
Main.TextENG: ``Our pain is the pain of losing a mother.@k@vS05/17/102300008. ...I don't think it completely makes up for it, but the pain of losing a grandchild...@k@vS05/17/102300009. ...keh keh keh keh!@k@vS05/17/102300010. He'll have to bear with that for a bit.@k@vS05/17/102300011. ...Don't you think?``

Main.TextJPN: …最後の問いかけは誰に言われたものでもない。@k…まるで、同意を一同に求めるように言った言葉だった。
Main.TextENG: ...The last question wasn't addressed to anybody in particular.@k ...It was as if she was looking for consensus.

Main.TextJPN: 「………だが、…土地と人様の子どもでは訳が違うの。@k@vS05/17/102300013.……隠すのは構わんが、…怪我だけはさせたくないものよの。@k@vS05/17/102300014.…子には何の罪もね。@k@vS05/17/102300015.…大事にしたれな」
Main.TextENG: ``...Still... land and a human child are different things.@k@vS05/17/102300013. ...I don't mind hiding him here... but I want no harm to befall him.@k@vS05/17/102300014. ...The child isn't to blame.@k@vS05/17/102300015. ...Make sure to keep that in mind.``

Main.TextJPN: 「それはつまり…、鬼ヶ淵死守同盟が、誘拐事件に関与している、ということ？！」
Main.TextENG: ``That means that.... the Onigafuchi Guardians were involved in the kidnapping!?``

Main.TextJPN: 「…ん、…必ずしもそうとは言えねぇな」
Main.TextENG: ``..Hrm... I can't say for certain.``

Main.TextJPN: 「どうして？@k@vS05/13/101300394.　頭首であるお魎が、これほどまではっきりと、誘拐した孫の処遇について指示を出しているのに？！」
Main.TextENG: ``Why?@k@vS05/13/101300394. Even though their leader, Oryou, was clearly giving orders on the treatment of the kidnapped child!?``

Main.TextJPN: 「兄さん、こりゃね。@k@vS05/00/104400068.園崎家のいつものことなんだよ」
Main.TextENG: ``Lad, you see.@k@vS05/00/104400068. This is what the Sonozaki Family always does.``

Main.TextJPN: 「…いつものこと？@k@vS05/13/101300396.　それは…どういう意味です？」
Main.TextENG: ``...Always does?@k@vS05/13/101300396. What do you mean by that?``

Main.TextJPN: …ある問題が持ち上がったとする。
Main.TextENG: ...Let's say there was a particular problem.

Main.TextJPN: …それが園崎家にとって好ましくない問題だったとする。
Main.TextENG: ...One that wasn't exactly favorable for the Sonozaki family.

Main.TextJPN: その問題に対して、お魎が『憂慮』すると、@k……それを聞いた、親族会議に出席していた誰かが『気を利かせる』。
Main.TextENG: If Oryou shows 'concern' over that particular problem,@k hearing that, somebody who attended the family council would 'be helpful.'

Main.TextJPN: 結果、お魎の希望はかなう。
Main.TextENG: As a result, Oryou's wish would be granted.

Main.TextJPN: …だが、お魎も誰も、実際に手を下した者が誰かはわからない。
Main.TextENG: ...However, neither Oryou or anybody else would know who actually did it.

Main.TextJPN: …この巧妙な仕掛けにより、園崎家は陰に陽に暗躍してきたのだ。
Main.TextENG: With this kind of clever little ploy, the Sonozaki family was able to manipulate events even though they had their hands laid out on the table.

Main.TextJPN: 「では…、親族会議に出席していた誰かが犯人ということですか？」
Main.TextENG: ``Then... that means that somebody who was at the family council was the culprit?``

Main.TextJPN: 「あるいは、そもそも犯人なんかいない可能性だってあるよな。@k@vS05/00/104400070.…お魎自身、その満座の一同の中に、誘拐犯がいるって確信を持ってるわけじゃない。@k@vS05/00/104400071.ただ、自分の『意見』を述べただけさ」
Main.TextENG: ``Or, there's the possibility that there was never a culprit in the first place.@k@vS05/00/104400070. ...Oryou herself, in that room full of people, didn't explicitly say that somebody pulled off the kidnapping.@k@vS05/00/104400071. She was just giving her 'opinion.'``

Main.TextJPN: …薄気味悪さを伴う、奇妙な秘密主義。
Main.TextENG: It was an odd and unpleasantly secretive way of doing things.

Main.TextJPN: ……関与しているのか、関与していないのか。@k…ベールの向こうが、よく見えない。
Main.TextENG: ...Were they involved or weren't they?@k ...I couldn't see beyond the veil.

Main.TextJPN: だが、これだけははっきりと言えた。
Main.TextENG: This much, however, I could say with certainty.

Main.TextJPN: 今回の誘拐事件は、完全に秘匿されている。@k…どのような立場にあれ、知ることはない。
Main.TextENG: This kidnapping was an ironclad secret.@k ...No matter how high a position somebody was in, even they wouldn't know about it.

Main.TextJPN: 知りうる立場があるとすれば、…公安関係者。@kつまり我々。
Main.TextENG: If there was somebody who would know about it, they would be connected to Public Safety.@k In other words, one of us.

Main.TextJPN: もしくは、……事件への関与者。
Main.TextENG: The only other options were people connected to the case itself.

Main.TextJPN: …大臣を含む、事件の当事者。@k…あるいは、……実行犯。
Main.TextENG: ...Including the Minister, there would be people affected by the incident.@k ...Or... the people that committed it.

Main.TextJPN: …いずれにせよ、……東京から、高速を乗り継いで６時間もかかるような…こんな地方の旧家が知りうるわけがないのだ。@k知っている時点で、すでにおかしいのだ。
Main.TextENG: ...In any case... there was no way an old household in a place removed from Tokyo by over 6 hours of highway travel should know about it.@k Them knowing at all was already strange.

Main.TextJPN: ……………疑惑が、募る。@k…降り積もる。
Main.TextENG: ...My suspicions began to accumulate.@k ...Like falling snow.

Main.TextJPN: 「…孫の誘拐についてお魎が述べたのはここまでだ。@k@vS05/00/104400073.…あんたの知りたかったことが含まれてりゃいいんだがな」
Main.TextENG: ``...That's as much as Oryou said in regards to the kidnapping.@k@vS05/00/104400073. ...Hopefully what you wanted to find out was in there.``

Main.TextJPN: 「……あとは兄ちゃんの仕事だな。@k@vS05/00/104400075.…何のお仕事やってるか知らんけど、園崎家を相手にするなら、相当の覚悟でやっとけよ。@k@vS05/00/104400076.…大石の旦那は怖いもの知らずだけどな、あれでも２～３回は襲われてる」
Main.TextENG: ``...After this, it's up to you.@k@vS05/00/104400075. ...I don't know what kind of work you're doing, but if you're going up against the Sonozaki family, you'd best prepare yourself.@k@vS05/00/104400076. ...Ooishi might be fearless, but even he's been attacked two or three times.\:

Main.TextJPN: 「最近は着てないけど、一時は、オフの時も防刃ベストを着込んでたんだよな」
Main.TextENG: ``He hasn't been wearing it lately, but at one point he was wearing a stab-proof vest while off-duty.``

Main.TextJPN: 「………えぇ。@k@vS05/13/101300400.…忠告ありがとうございます。気をつけることにします」
Main.TextENG: ``...Oh?@k@vS05/13/101300400. ...Thanks for the warning. I'll be careful.``

Main.TextJPN: 「…標準語が流暢だよなぁ。@k@vS05/00/104400079.兄さんは東京とかの人？」
Main.TextENG: ``...You speak pretty well.@k@vS05/00/104400079. Are you from Tokyo, by any chance?``
``Huh?@k@vS05/13/101300402. ...What's your point?``

Main.TextJPN: 捜査官は常に危険と隣り合わせだ。@k…自分の情報は極力、開示しない方がいい。
Main.TextENG: Investigators were always close to danger.@k ...It was best not to divulge any information on myself.

Main.TextJPN: 「兄さんのお仕事だけどさ。@k@|@y@vS05/00/104400081.…ひょっとして、警視庁の公安部の人ってことはある？」
Main.TextENG: ``Your job.@k@|@y@vS05/00/104400081. ...Could you possibly be somebody from the Metropolitan Public Safety Division?``

Main.TextJPN: そう思っていた矢先に、いきなり核心を突いたような質問を受ける、私は…。
Main.TextENG: Just as I was thinking that, I suddenly get a question that gets to the heart of the matter, I...

Main.titleENG: Getting to the heart of the matter...

Main.TextJPN: ここで言葉を詰まらせては駄目だ。@k認めたも同然になってしまう。
Main.TextENG: I couldn't remain silent here.@k It would be the same thing as admitting it.

Main.TextJPN: 「…こっから、旦那からもらった金の範囲には入らないんだが…。@k@vS05/00/104400083.兄さんとは今日、卓を囲んだ仲間だからな。@k@vS05/00/104400084.サービスってことで話してやるよ。@k@vS05/00/104400085.…お魎から誘拐の話が出た後、もうひとつ話題が出たんだ」
Main.TextENG: ``...This wasn't accounted for in the money I got from the boss...@k@vS05/00/104400083. but as somebody who played at the same table today,@k@vS05/00/104400084. I'll give you this one as a freebie.@k@vS05/00/104400085. After Oryou talked about the kidnapping, there was one other topic that came up.``

Main.TextJPN: お魎から出されたもうひとつの話題。
Main.TextENG: Another topic that Oryou brought up?

Main.TextJPN: …そしてその話の直前に、サトさんに聞かれた、警視庁公安部の人？@k　という言葉。
Main.TextENG: ...And right before he told me this, Sato-san asked if I was from the Metropolitan Public Safety Division?@k In other words...

Main.TextJPN: …その二つの意味するところが、背筋を急激に冷やす。
Main.TextENG: ...What those two things meant caused a chill to run up my spine.

Main.TextJPN: 「…そんれでな。@k@vS05/00/oldE00002.…大臣の孫、さらったーのを調べるために、@k@vS05/00/oldE00003.東京からはるばる、公安の捜査官が派遣されてくるっちゅう話だ」
Main.TextENG: ``...So you see...@k@vS05/00/oldE00002. ...That in order to investigate the kidnapping of the Minister's grandson,@k@vS05/00/oldE00003. there's word that there will be an investigator from Public Safety dispatched all the way from Tokyo.``

Main.TextJPN: 「…公安の捜査官？」
Main.TextENG: ``...An investigator from Public Safety?``

Main.TextJPN: 「…大臣の孫の誘拐な、…迂闊にゃ大事にできゃんってことで、@k@vS05/00/oldE00005.警視庁の公安部が独自で調べとるっちゅう話だ。@k@vS05/00/oldE00006.…大仰なこったのぉ。@k@vS05/00/oldE00007.…………ん？@k@vS05/00/oldE00008.　どうした？」
Main.TextENG: ``...They can't be reckless and make a big deal over the kidnapping,@k@vS05/00/oldE00005. so it seems the Metropolitan Public Safety Division is investigating this on their own.@k@vS05/00/oldE00006. ...Ain't that grand.@k@vS05/00/oldE00007. ...Hm?@k@vS05/00/oldE00008. What is it?``

Main.TextJPN: 今まで、話に何の興味も示さず、ずっとお絵描きをしていた梨花が、公安の話が始まった途端に、お絵描きをやめ、興味の表情をお魎に向けた。
Main.TextENG: Rika, who had been drawing the entire time and was completely uninterested in the conversation up until now, looked at Oryou with an interested face as soon as the topic of Public Safety came up.

Main.TextJPN: 「…警視ちょーが、来たのですか？」
Main.TextENG: ``...Did the Metropolitan Police come?``

Main.TextJPN: 「ぉぅぉぅ…梨花ちゃまは警視庁も知ってなさるんかい。@k@vS05/00/oldE00010.…偉いのぉ」
Main.TextENG: ``Ohhh ...So Rika-chama knows about the Metropolitan Police Department?@k@vS05/00/oldE00010. ...That's very admirable.``

Main.TextJPN: 「…………誰が来たのですか？」
Main.TextENG: ``...Who came?``

Main.TextJPN: 「…公安のどんなヤツが来よったんか、…誰ぞ、わかるやつはおらんかいな」
Main.TextENG: ``...Is there anybody that knows what kind of guy from Public Safety came here?``

Main.TextJPN: 魅音の父親が小さく挙手をする。
Main.TextENG: Mion's father raised his hand slightly.

Main.TextJPN: 「……新米の若造がひとり、と聞き及んでおります」
Main.TextENG: ``...I hear that it's a nice young piece of fresh meat.``
``...Fresh meat?@k@vS05/27/100500100. Is it nice and tender?``

Main.TextJPN: 「…ん？　…んふふふ！@k@vS05/00/mionF00003.　えぇ、はい。@k@vS05/00/mionF00004.…新米とか」
Main.TextENG: ``Hm? Haha!@k@vS05/00/mionF00003. Yeah, it is.@k@vS05/00/mionF00004. ...Fresh meat.``

Main.TextJPN: 魅音の父は苦笑しながら、梨花の質問に答えた。
Main.TextENG: Mion's father smiled wryly as he answered Rika's question.

Main.TextJPN: 「…ほかほかのふっかふか？」
Main.TextENG: ``...Tender and tasty?``

Main.TextJPN: 「…えぇ」
「ほかほかのふっかふか」
Main.TextENG: ``Tender and tasty.``

Main.TextJPN: 梨花は面白おかしそうに微笑んでいた。
Main.TextENG: Rika smiled with interest.

Main.TextJPN: …なぜ急にこの話題に限って、梨花が興味を示したのか。@k…それは誰にもわからないようだった。
Main.TextENG: ...Why did Rika suddenly act interested only when it came to this topic?@k ...That was a question that apparently nobody had the answer to.

Main.TextJPN: 「…梨花ちゃまは、その男のことを何か知っているのかの」
Main.TextENG: ``...Does Rika-chama know something about this man?``

Main.TextJPN: 梨花はそれだけを無愛想に告げると、またお魎の布団の中に潜り込んでしまった…。
Main.TextENG: After her rather flat reply, Rika buried herself underneath Oryou's futon again...

Main.TextJPN: だが梨花はもうお絵描きはせず、あれこれ思案するような表情をしながら、布団に潜り込んでしまう…。
Main.TextENG: But when she buried herself there, Rika no longer started drawing again. Instead, she was making an expression like she was deep in contemplation...

Main.TextJPN: 「……どうしますか？@k@vS05/00/mionF00007.　御母さん」
Main.TextENG: ``...What shall we do about him?@k@vS05/00/mionF00007. Mother.``

Main.TextJPN: 魅音の父が問いかける。@k……その無骨な表情は、命令さえあればいつでもひねり潰して見せる…と言っているようにも見えた。
Main.TextENG: Mion's father posed the question.@k ...He had the type of uncouth expression on his face indicating that, given the order, he could snuff the problem out at any time.

Main.TextJPN: 「…はるばる雛見沢まで来よったん。@k@vS05/17/102300017.…しばらくはのんびりさせてやるのもよかろ」
Main.TextENG: ``...He came all the way to Hinamizawa.@k@vS05/17/102300017. ...Let him take it easy for a little while.``

Main.TextJPN: 「泳がせろ、ということでしょうか…？」
Main.TextENG: ``So you're saying to just let him go around as he pleases...?``

Main.TextJPN: 魅音の父が問い返す。
Main.TextENG: Mion's father asked in response.

Main.TextJPN: …お魎は薄っすらと微笑んでから答えた。
Main.TextENG: Oryou smiled thinly as she responded.

Main.TextJPN: 「……ほっといたれな。@k@vS05/17/102300019.…が、…あぁんまりオイタが過ぎるよぅやったん、そんときゃ、遠慮せんとな。@k@vS05/17/102300020.…舐められるのは、好っきゃせんね」
Main.TextENG: ``...Leave him alone.@k@vS05/17/102300019. ...But... If he starts causing too much mischief, when that happens, don't hold back.@k@vS05/17/102300020. ...I don't enjoy being taken lightly.``

Main.TextJPN: 「………………なんて話があったそうだ。@k@vS05/00/104400087.…まさかあんた、その警視庁の新米じゃないよな？」
Main.TextENG: ``...Is what they talked about apparently.@k@vS05/00/104400087. ...It couldn't be that you're that fresh meat from the Metropolitan Police, are you?``
``....It couldn't be.@k@vS05/13/101300408. ...Hahahaha.``

Main.TextJPN: 背筋を、…ぞわぞわとした冷たい、毛むくじゃらのものが這い上がってくる感覚。
Main.TextENG: The sensation of cold, bristling fear began to crawl its way up my back.

Main.TextJPN: この親族会議が行われたのは、昨夜。@k…つまり、昨日。
Main.TextENG: This family council took place, last night.@k ...In other words, yesterday.

Main.TextJPN: …では、今日、私が雛見沢に観光客を装って向かった時、すでに、…私の身元は割れていた？
Main.TextENG: ...Then, today, when I was dressed up as a tourist headed towards Hinamizawa... my cover was already blown?

Main.TextJPN: …バス停について、一番最初に出迎えてくれた人物が誰だったかを思い出し、…呼吸が止まる。
Main.TextENG: ...When I remembered the first person I met when I got to the bus stop... I couldn't breathe.

Main.TextJPN: ……親族会議で、警視庁から派遣された男に興味を示した、古手梨花。
Main.TextENG: ...The person at the family council who expressed interest in the man being dispatched from the Metropolitan Police, Rika Furude.

Main.TextJPN: そして、…停留所で私が来るのをずっと待っていたのも、古手梨花。
Main.TextENG: And then, the person who was waiting for me the whole time in the bus shelter, Rika Furude.

Main.TextJPN: …考えたくない想像。@k…いや、妄想。
Main.TextENG: ...It was an unthinkable image.@k ...No, it was a delusion.

Main.TextJPN: あの停留所で出会ったとき、…すでに梨花ちゃんは、私の正体を知っていた？
Main.TextENG: When we met at that bus shelter... did Rika-chan already know my true identity?

Main.TextJPN: 私を、警視庁から派遣された赤坂だと知って、迎えていた…？
Main.TextENG: Did she know that I was Akasaka, dispatched from the Metropolitan Police Department, and come to meet me...?

Main.TextJPN: …では、公由村長も含め、…私に接してくれた村人たちは…みんな知ってて知らないふりをしていた…？
Main.TextENG: ...Then, including Mayor Kimiyoshi... every villager that I met... everybody knew but just pretended not to...?

Main.TextJPN: お魎が手を出すなと指示したから？
Main.TextENG: Because Oryou had given instructions not to interfere?

Main.TextJPN: …………それは…冷静に考えて、…ないと思う。
Main.TextENG: ...Thinking about it logically... ...it didn't seem possible.

Main.TextJPN: あれだけの人間と接した。
Main.TextENG: I met quite a number of people.

Main.TextJPN: …演技のうまい人間もいれば、隠し事の下手な人間もいる。
Main.TextENG: ...If there's people that are good at acting, then there's people who are bad at hiding things.

Main.TextJPN: …あれだけの人間がいれば、中には私を公安と知っていたら、敵対心を隠しきれない者もいたはずだ。
Main.TextENG: ...If there was that many people, then there should have been somebody among them who knew I was from Public Safety and couldn't hide their hostility.

Main.TextJPN: …でも、そんな気配はまったく感じられなかった。
Main.TextENG: ...However, I didn't feel any presence like that.

Main.TextJPN: でも、だからといって、……。
Main.TextENG: But then, even still...

Main.TextJPN: …お魎はどうして泳がせろと指示したのか。
Main.TextENG: ...Why did Oryou tell them to leave me alone?

Main.TextJPN: 下手に手を出して、痛くもない腹を探られたくないから？
Main.TextENG: Was it because if they were careless about it, it would only raise more suspicion?

Main.TextJPN: それとも、私如きの新米に何も探れないと思っているから？
Main.TextENG: Or was it because they believed a rookie like me wouldn't be able to find anything?

Main.TextJPN: 赤坂は怖がりなのです。
Main.TextENG: Akasaka is a coward.

Main.TextJPN: …あの、…梨花ちゃんに取り憑いたとしか思えない、…怪しい声を思い出す。
Main.TextENG: ...I recalled that strange voice which could only make me believe that Rika-chan had been possessed.

Main.TextJPN: ……あの、得体の知れない何者かは、どう考えても、私の正体を初めから知っていたとしか思えない。
Main.TextENG: ...That unknown entity, no matter how you looked at it, knew my true identity from the get-go.

Main.TextJPN: …そして、…何を警告したんだっけ。
Main.TextENG: ...And then... how did it warn me again?

Main.TextJPN: そうだ。@k…早く東京へ帰れ、と警告したのだ。
Main.TextENG: That's right.@k ...It warned me to hurry up and go back to Tokyo.

Main.TextJPN: 鬼ヶ淵死守同盟に、…自分の身元が割られているという、現実的な不安より、…正体不明の少女が、警告する非現実的な不安の方が、なぜか勝って感じられた。
Main.TextENG: Instead of the realistic worry that the Onigafuchi Guardians had discovered my identity, the absurd worry brought on by the unknown girl stuck with me more.

Main.TextJPN: …あの少女は何者だろう。@k…やがて後悔すること、とは何だろう。
Main.TextENG: ...What exactly was that girl?@k ...What was the thing I would eventually regret?

Main.TextJPN: 奇怪な少女。@k…古手梨花。
Main.TextENG: That mysterious girl.@k ...Rika Furude.

Main.TextJPN: やめよう。@k…今は考えるのはよそう。
Main.TextENG: Let's stop this.@k ...Everything I was thinking of right now was merely conjecture.

Main.TextJPN: 明日、朝一番で、今聞いたことを本庁に連絡して指示を仰ごう。
Main.TextENG: Tomorrow, first thing in the morning, I'll report everything I heard right now to HQ and await further orders.

Main.TextJPN: 鬼ヶ淵死守同盟が、今回の事件に関与している可能性が出てきたのは間違いない。
Main.TextENG: There was no mistaking that the possibility the Onigafuchi Guardians were related to this case was there.

Main.TextJPN: …それに、敵に身元が割られた以上、危険な状態と言える。
Main.TextENG: ...And that the fact that my cover was blown meant I was in a precarious position.

Main.TextJPN: …もっとも本庁も今は全職員が多忙を極め、応援の余地などないかもしれないが。
Main.TextENG: ...But as everybody at HQ was already extremely busy, they might not be able to spare the support.

Main.TextJPN: 「…いえ、そんなことは。@k@vS05/13/VX_akasaka_0014.ただ私は、東京でおきた誘拐事件の犯人を追っているだけです」
Main.TextENG: \...No, not at all.@k@vS05/13/VX_akasaka_0014. I'm just trying to track down the perpetrator of a kidnapping in Tokyo.``

Main.TextJPN: 努めて冷静を装いながら、私はこの手の質問に備えてあらかじめ用意していた答えを返す。
Main.TextENG: Trying to keep my cool, I replied with an answer that I had prepared in advance for this kind of question.

Main.TextJPN: サトさんは私の顔をちら、と盗み見てから『…そうかい？』と曖昧な返事をして、それ以上は何も訊ねてこなかった。
Main.TextENG: He glanced at my face and replied vaguely, ``...Is that so?``. Didn't ask any more questions.

Main.TextJPN: 「…もういいかい？@k@vS05/00/104400089.　よければ好きなところまで送るよ」
Main.TextENG: ``...Is that everything?@k@vS05/00/104400089. If you want, I can drop you off wherever you like.``

Main.TextJPN: 「あ、…すみません。@k@vS05/13/101300410.では、お会いした元の駅までお願いします」
Main.TextENG: ``Ah... sorry.@k@vS05/13/101300410. In that case, the station where we originally met, please.``

Main.TextJPN: 外灯すらまばらな、田舎の街道。
Main.TextENG: A rural road where even a street light was rare.

Main.TextJPN: …何も見えない。
Main.TextENG: ...I couldn't see anything.

Main.TextJPN: ヘッドライトに照らされるアスファルト以外は何もわからない。
Main.TextENG: I wasn't aware of anything but the asphalt that was lit up by the headlights.

Main.TextJPN: 灯りの外は、ただの闇か。@k何者かが潜んでこちらをうかがっているのか。
Main.TextENG: Outside of that light, was it simply darkness?@k Or was there something lurking there, waiting to strike?

Main.TextJPN: ……嫌な仕事だな、と思った。
Main.TextENG: ...I had to think I drew the short straw here.

Main.TextJPN: …東京に帰りたい。
Main.TextENG: ...I wanted to go back to Tokyo.

Main.TextJPN: 東京へ帰れ、と警告したあの少女の声が、なぜかいつまでも頭に残っていた…。
Main.TextENG: For some reason, the voice of the girl warning me to go back to Tokyo still lingered in my head...
